title: A Tough Drill at Witch Hazel Hill
summary: Written by Alex Jones, Ph.D. candidate at Imperial College London  After a busy few months exploring the outer slopes of the Jezero crater rim at an area named “Witch Hazel Hill,” the Perseverance Science Team was eyeing another sample of these truly ancient rocks, which likely predate Jezero crater itself.   The target? title: Lawmakers raise alarm over rumored cuts to commercial satellite imagery funding
summary:
Rep. Seth Moulton: 'I am especially concerned about the rumor that the National Reconnaissance Office, at the direction of OMB, has slashed commercial imagery funding lines in the FY26 budget'

title: China launches first of 2,800 satellites for AI space computing constellation
summary:
China launched 12 satellites early Wednesday for a pioneering on-orbit computing project led by startup ADA Space and Zhejiang Lab.

title: Rocket Lab to launch NASA astrophysics smallsat mission
summary:
NASA selected Rocket Lab to launch a small NASA astrophysics spacecraft that will study galaxies at ultraviolet wavelengths.

title: Arabsat seeks Telesat Lightspeed capacity as Starlink expands into Saudi Arabia
summary:
Saudi Arabia's Arabsat signed a deal for broadband capacity from Telesat’s proposed low Earth orbit constellation, a day after SpaceX CEO Elon Musk announced approval to sell LEO services to maritime and aviation customers in the region.

title: NASA Awards Launch Service Task Order for Aspera’s Galaxy Mission
summary: NASA has selected Rocket Lab USA Inc. of Long Beach, California, to launch the agency’s Aspera mission, a SmallSat to study galaxy formation and evolution, providing new insights into how the universe works. title: Kepler demonstrates space-to-ground optical links for proposed relay network
summary:
Canada’s Kepler Communications said it has successfully demonstrated optical data links between a prototype satellite in low Earth orbit and a partner’s ground station for the first time.
